conversation.content: I noticed my premium account was downgraded to basic last week. I never authorized this change.
I apologize for the unexpected change to your account. Let me pull up your account details right away to investigate what happened with your service level.
I've been a premium member for three years. This shouldn't happen without my explicit consent.
You're absolutely right, and I completely understand your concern. I can see your account number is AC-88294-XL and you've indeed maintained premium status since January 2021 without interruption.
Can you explain what triggered this downgrade? I need to understand the root cause here.
Certainly.
My automated services stopped working yesterday. That's how I discovered the change.
I've identified the issue now. There was a payment processing error on December 3rd when your card ending in 4782 was declined, which triggered an automatic downgrade after our 7-day grace period.
That card was replaced due to fraud. I updated my payment information two weeks ago.

I can see you did update to a new card ending in 5923 on November 28th, but unfortunately there was a system synchronization error that prevented the update from applying to your recurring billing profile.
So this was a technical failure on your end, not a payment issue on mine?

That's correct, and I sincerely apologize for this error. I'm immediately reinstating your premium service with activation code PRM-RESTORE-92847, and you'll have full functionality within the next 15 minutes.
What about the four days I lost access to premium features?
Excellent question.
I rely on those automated workflows for my business operations.

I completely understand the impact this has had on your business. I'm applying a service credit of $47.96 to your account, which represents a full month of premium service, and adding a courtesy credit of $25.00 for the inconvenience.
That's fair. How do we prevent this from happening again?
I've flagged your account with protection code FSP-1147 to prevent automatic downgrades, and I've manually verified your new payment method is properly synchronized across all our billing systems.
Good. Can you send me written confirmation of everything we discussed today?
Absolutely. I'm sending a detailed summary to your email on file within the next 10 minutes, including your case reference number CS-20241210-KM847 and all applied credits and corrections.

scenario: asking why their service was downgraded without consent
